thread.title: Texas & Neighbors: Enjoy music, camping at Marfa festival
thread.title_full: Texas & Neighbors: Enjoy music, camping at Marfa festival | Dallas Morning News

author: dallasnews
title: Texas & Neighbors: Enjoy music, camping at Marfa festival
text:
MARFA Desert locale draws music lovers to eclectic fest Lovers of folk, rock and indie music should make the trek to Marfa from Sept. 24 to 27. The 10th annual Trans-Pecos Festival of Music and Love will include the Independent Music Awards’ best rock album winner Ben Kweller, Portland-based indie band Portugal, Jenny Lewis and many more.
The festival takes place at El Cosmico, a 21-acre community-lodging destination in the desert. There are several on-site accommodations for attendees, including deluxe, furnished tents. Space is limited, so those interested should reserve now.
This year’s event also will feature several workshops for folk artists of all abilities. These include cooking, crafting and art demos on skills from Dutch oven cooking to shibori fabric dyeing. Other don’t-miss offerings are the vendor area with locally made items, tarot card readings and a sandlot baseball game.
Advance discounted weekend passes are $165 for three nights of music or $220 for three nights of music and camping. Workshop registration starts at $25 per person. There is no RV hookup on site. The cost to bring an RV is $125 in addition to the purchase of festival passes.
Contact: 432-729-1950; elcosmico.com
AUSTIN Paramount Theatre to celebrate 100 years with relighting The centennial celebration of Austin’s historic Paramount Theatre will include a sign relighting ceremony Sept. 23. The venue is home to red-carpet film premieres and is part of SXSW and the Austin Film Festival.
The original Paramount sign, which was first installed on the theater’s facade in 1930, was taken down for restoration in the 1960s and was never seen again. Organizers have re-created the sign with historical accuracy, reviewing photos and videos with the help of Wagner Sign Co.
There will be multiple sites with prime views of the ceremony, including a street party on Congress Avenue with music by New Breed Brass Band. After the relighting of the sign, which is 50 feet tall and 7,100 pounds, the party will continue inside with a CD-release show for singer-songwriter Patty Griffin.
Additional private parties include the Terrace Bar at the InterContinental Stephen F. Austin, the Contemporary Austin, the Townsend and private residences nearby. Multiple packages and ticket options are available online.
Contact: 512-474-1221; austintheatre.org
BASTROP Art conference to feature classes, events for all skill levels Celebrate all things related to art at the Lost Pines Regional Arts Conference, hosted by the Bastrop Fine Arts Guild. This event will include more than 100 classes, demonstrations, lectures and workshops at multiple galleries and pop-up venues along the Colorado River in downtown Bastrop from Sept. 18 to 20.
Among the offerings: a timely social-media class and the multiple “fitness for artists” events, which will emphasize relief for neck, back and shoulders. Kid-friendly classes include creative writing, paper crafting and painting with watercolors. Keynote speaker Jason Horejs, who is owner of Xanadu Gallery in Scottsdale, Ariz., will also do portfolio reviews.
One-day passes start at $40, but some workshops have extra fees. Advance registration is suggested.
Contact: lostpinesregionalartsconference.com ; visitlostpines.com
TODD MISSION Enjoy new market, costume ball at Renaissance Festival Tickets for the country’s largest Renaissance celebration are available now. The Texas Renaissance Festival, a 55-acre event that was named the best cultural festival in the nation by USA Today , takes place over eight weekends from Oct. 10 through Nov. 29 northwest of Houston.
New draws this season will include a Florence Market inside New Market Village and TRF After Dark, a costume ball for guests 21 and older.
Tickets start at $24 for adults, $12 for ages 5-12. Also, those younger than 12 get in free each Sunday this season. Attendees can bring their RV, trailer or tent and stay on-site at the Fields of New Market Campgrounds or enjoy hotel lodging nearby.
Contact: texrenfest.com
